inputs.task: Design and improve the LaunchBase homepage from first principles
inputs.whitePaper:
LaunchBase is an operating system for small businesses.
Not a website builder. Not another tool. Not a one-time agency project.

LaunchBase is ongoing ownership of a business's digital operating layer:
- website uptime + maintenance
- lead capture + forms
- monitoring + safety decisions
- updates + publishing cadence
- integrations + visibility
- logging + accountability

LaunchBase exists because most small businesses already have tools, but no one owns the system.
They have a website, a payment tool, a calendar, a Google profile, and logins…
…but the owner still carries the burden of making sure everything works.

LaunchBase sells relief from that cognitive load.

Core customer pain: The customer isn't buying a website. They're buying the ability to stop thinking about:
- "Is it still working?"
- "Did that form actually send?"
- "What should I post?"
- "Is anything broken?"
- "Am I missing something?"

This is background anxiety, not a feature gap.
The enemy is not "lack of tools."
The enemy is lack of ownership.

LaunchBase replaces the customer as the default system-checker.

Promise:
✅ Change is reversible
✅ Non-action is safe
✅ Silence is a valid decision
✅ Every action is logged
✅ Customer sees their real site before paying
✅ LaunchBase acts only after approval

The brand is accountability.
LaunchBase is responsibility-as-a-service.

Target customer:
- owner-operator
- service business
- small team
- not "tech obsessed"
- wants a business to run, not to "manage tools"

Tone: calm, competent, honest, operationally serious, safety-first, premium but not flashy.
This is a systems product, not a "creative brand party."

Design objective:
✅ Create instant trust
✅ Communicate the contract clearly
✅ Show the "safe-by-default" nature
✅ Make "Hand It Off" feel low-risk
✅ Explain observability in plain English
✅ Look premium enough to justify recurring ownership

currentCopy.hero: Stop carrying the system in your head. Hand it off. Keep visibility.
currentCopy.problem: No one owns the system. You're the fallback for everything.
currentCopy.solution: LaunchBase becomes the owner. You stay informed, not involved.
currentCopy.trust: Safe by default. Fully logged. Reversible.

inputs.audience: Owner-operators of service businesses (fitness studios, coffee shops, consulting firms) who want stability and accountability, not tool management
inputs.tone: Calm, minimal, trustworthy, premium. Avoid hype. Avoid 'AI magic.' Avoid exaggerated claims.
inputs.constraints: Mobile-first. Must feel like 'responsibility-as-a-service.' Must emphasize safety, reversibility, observability. Must reduce mental load while reading.

proposedChanges.value: Add a visual representation of 'handing off' a system with a simple animated graphic; keep hero text concise.
proposedChanges.rationale: Visuals can quickly communicate the concept of 'handing off' and aid in user understanding.
risks: Might distract if overdone

proposedChanges.value: Move the 'trust' section immediately after the hero to reinforce safety and reversibility right away.
proposedChanges.rationale: Trust is a key selling point and should be established early in the user journey.
risks: Could delay understanding the problem-solution dynamic

proposedChanges.value: Use a two-column layout to present problem and solution side by side for direct comparison.
proposedChanges.rationale: A side-by-side comparison can help users quickly grasp the value proposition.
risks: Requires careful balancing to avoid overwhelming the page

proposedChanges.value: Convert pricing tables to cards with one highlighted default tier; add 'what you get' bullets under each tier.
proposedChanges.rationale: Cards with bulleted benefits make pricing options clearer and more enticing.
risks: Highlighting one tier may lead to other tiers being overlooked

proposedChanges.value: Ensure primary CTA is prominent and repeated throughout the page with consistent design.
proposedChanges.rationale: Consistent CTA design helps users take action more easily.
risks: Could be seen as repetitive if overused

proposedChanges.value: Add sticky primary CTA on mobile after 40% scroll; keep secondary CTA in hero only.
proposedChanges.rationale: A sticky CTA ensures constant accessibility on mobile, improving conversion rates.
risks: May annoy users if it obstructs content

proposedChanges.value: Include a small screenshot or mockup of an audit log to visually represent accountability.
proposedChanges.rationale: Visual representation of an audit log reinforces the transparency and trust aspect.
risks: Might clutter the design if not well-integrated

proposedChanges.value: Implement a simple step-by-step guide using icons and brief descriptions to explain the process.
proposedChanges.rationale: Clear steps can help demystify the process and reduce cognitive load.
risks: Icons must be clear and relevant to avoid confusion

proposedChanges.value: Add a 'proof bar' displaying client logos or testimonials just before the pricing section.
proposedChanges.rationale: Social proof near pricing can influence purchasing decisions positively.
risks: Requires credible and recognizable logos/testimonials

proposedChanges.value: Include quick access links to privacy policy, terms of service, and a contact form in the footer.
proposedChanges.rationale: Easy access to legal and contact information enhances trust and user experience.
risks: May overload the footer if not organized well

proposedChanges.value: Use a type scale with 8px increments starting at 16px for body text, ensuring readability and calmness
proposedChanges.rationale: A consistent type scale with small increments conveys stability and calmness
risks: May not stand out enough for some users

proposedChanges.value: Adopt a soft blue (#6C8EBF) as the primary color to evoke calmness and trust
proposedChanges.rationale: Soft blue is often associated with tranquility and reliability, aligning with brand values
risks: Potentially too common and not distinctive enough

proposedChanges.value: Use pill-shaped buttons with 16px padding, subtle shadow, no gradients
proposedChanges.rationale: This button style feels premium and approachable, aligning with the brand's calm and confident tone
risks: Might not be as attention-grabbing as more vibrant styles

proposedChanges.value: Adopt a shadow depth of 2px with a 16px corner radius for cards
proposedChanges.rationale: A subtle shadow and rounded corners give a sense of depth while maintaining a premium feel
risks: Could blend into the background if not properly contrasted

proposedChanges.value: Show a 3-chip row: 'Safe by default • Fully auditable • Reversible changes'
proposedChanges.rationale: Chips are a concise way to communicate key trust signals and reinforce the brand promise
risks: Overloading visual space with too many elements

proposedChanges.value: Use a timeline format with icons for each logged action to emphasize observability
proposedChanges.rationale: A timeline format visually represents the concept of tracking and accountability
risks: Could become cluttered if too many actions are shown at once

proposedChanges.value: Standardize corner radius to 8px across all components for a cohesive look
proposedChanges.rationale: Consistent corner radius ensures visual harmony and a polished appearance
risks: May reduce the distinctiveness of certain elements

proposedChanges.value: Apply a consistent 2px shadow for all interactive elements to subtly highlight them
proposedChanges.rationale: A consistent shadow depth across elements provides a cohesive interface experience
risks: Subtle shadows may not provide enough contrast in certain lighting conditions

proposedChanges.value: Use thin, light grey dividers (1px) to subtly separate sections without overwhelming
proposedChanges.rationale: Thin dividers create structure while maintaining a minimal and calm aesthetic
risks: Dividers may be too subtle for users with visual impairments

proposedChanges.value: Select a warm grey (#F5F5F5) as the background to create a welcoming environment
proposedChanges.rationale: Warm neutrals evoke a sense of comfort and approachability
risks: May not contrast well with all text colors

proposedChanges.value: Design chips with 12px height and 8px padding, using the accent color for emphasis
proposedChanges.rationale: Compact chips with accent colors draw attention to key points without being intrusive
risks: Could become visually cluttered if too many chips are used

proposedChanges.value: Set max text width to 65ch for body copy to improve readability
proposedChanges.rationale: Limiting line length increases readability and reduces cognitive load
risks: May result in more vertical scrolling on smaller screens

swarm.reason: Missing craft or critic artifact for collapse
